content: Filling out the form was forcibly stopped

comment.text: This translation key is used for the title of a "BadgeStoppedTitle" indicator, which indicates that the user's turn has been forcibly stopped while filling out a form. The translated version appears in a specific UI context where the form status transitions to "Stopped".

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Formanın doldurulması məcburi dayandırıldı' is a literal translation that doesn't quite capture the nuance of 'forcibly stopped'. 'Məcburi' implies something that was required or mandatory, which isn't the intended meaning here. A more natural translation would convey the interruption.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Formanın doldurulması dayandırıldı (sudddenly stopped) or Formanın doldurulması kəsildi (filling out the form was interrupted).

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'El rellenado del formulario se ha detenido de manera forzosa' is a bit too formal and verbose for a message indicating a form was forcibly stopped. It doesn't quite capture the immediacy and directness of the English.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more direct translation such as 'Se detuvo el llenado del formulario' or 'El formulario se detuvo' or 'El llenado del formulario fue interrumpido'.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase "Filling out the form was forcibly stopped" implies an action taken *against* the user. The Armenian translation "Ձևաթուղթը լրացնելը հարկադրաբար դադարեցվեց" literally translates to "The form filling was forcibly stopped" which, while technically correct, doesn't fully capture the sense of being interrupted or prevented. A better translation would convey the interruption.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider alternatives like "Ձևի լրացումը դադարեցվեց հարկադրաբար" (Form completion was forcibly stopped) or a more conversational phrasing indicating the user was stopped from completing it.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, 'forzatamente' (forcibly) adds a nuance that isn't explicitly present in the English 'forcibly stopped'. It implies an external force. A more neutral and closer translation would be better.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: La compilazione del modulo è stata interrotta

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The English phrase 'forcibly stopped' implies an involuntary action. While the Lao translation 'ຖືກຢຸດເຊົາຢ່າງບໍ່ຖືກຕ້ອງ' literally means 'was stopped inappropriately,' it doesn't convey the sense of being forced. A better translation would emphasize the involuntary nature of the stop.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: ການຕື່ມຂໍ້ມູນແບບຟອມຖືກຢຸດເຊົາໂດຍບໍ່ໄດ້ຮັບອະນຸຍາດ

ai_spell_check_issues.description: The translation 'Wypełniania formularza zostało przymusowo zatrzymane' is a bit literal and awkward in Polish. While technically correct, it doesn't flow naturally. A more natural phrasing would convey the same meaning more smoothly.

The English phrase 'Filling out the form was forcibly stopped' implies a forceful interruption of the form-filling process. While 'Попуњавање обрасца је насилно заустављено' (Popunjavanje obrasca je nasilno zaustavljeno) translates to 'Filling out the form was violently stopped,' 'насилно' (nasilno) implies a more aggressive or violent action than 'forcibly.' A more accurate translation conveying 'forcibly' would use a word like 'принудно' (prinudno).

The translation 'Popunjavanje obrasca je nasilno zaustavljeno' is too literal and conveys a slightly awkward tone. 'Nasilno' (forcibly) implies violence or coercion which isn't necessarily the intended meaning.
While technically correct, 'Formu doldurma işlemi zorla durduruldu' is a bit clunky and formal for the intended meaning of "Filling out the form was forcibly stopped." It's overly literal.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: Consider a more natural phrasing like 'Form doldurma işlemi kesildi' or 'Formu doldurmakla kesildiniz' to convey the same meaning in a more conversational Turkish.

ai_spell_check_issues.description: While technically correct, "中止" (zhongzhi) carries a stronger connotation of 'suspension' or 'termination' than the English "stopped." It implies a deliberate pause, whereas "forcibly stopped" suggests an interruption.
ai_spell_check_issues.suggestion: 表单填写被强制停止 (Bengdan tiandian bei qiangzhu tingzhi)
